---
title: Sign the Withdrawal Transaction
slug: /guides/staking-api/near/undelegate/sign-withdraw-transaction
---

Sign the withdrawal transaction using the `transaction_payload` you received in response to submitting the withdraw data.

Locate the `transaction_payload` in the response from the previous step. It will look something like this:

```json
"transaction_payload": ""
```

:::caution important

Always confirm the details of the transaction before signing the payload.

Figment has a tool for signing and decoding Staking API payloads, see the guide [Signing Transactions with Figment's npm Package](/guides/staking-api/figment-signing-transactions) to continue.

:::

Transactions can also be signed using the [NearJS API](https://docs.near.org/integrator/create-transactions#create-sign--send-transaction) or [Fireblocks](/guides/staking-api/fireblocks-signing-transactions).

Sign the transaction and move on to the next step. A signed transaction payload for NEAR will look something like this:

```text

```
